text: is being carried by a world weary middle European wearing armband.  VLADIMIR NEKHORVICH exits a gleaming building, for a moment, under a motto clearly visible above his hea 'Where the future is now' .  He checks the time.

set in  Countdown Mode. It's at 19 hours forty-seven minutes and  sixteen seconds and dropping, 19:37.15,  :14,  :13,  :12 O.S. children are singing: Ring a ring a rosy/a pocketful of posy/ a tissue a tissue/we all fall down. Nekhorvich looks to see children at play outside the adja Natural History Museum.  They are moving in and around an freeform sculpture.
a blur where the sculpture seems to be distorting the chi almost like mirrors in a fun house.
wipes his eyes, a horn honks.  He looks toward the sound.

on the belt that takes it thru X-Ray.  On the other side opens the satchel and pokes thru a few toilet articles, p items, books, a battleship gray digital camera and - in a plastic container marked 'S.G.' - a small, square shiny o hi-tech and at odds with the other items.  She pulls out shaped vessel.
What's this, then?
(handing her documents)
The ashes of a colleague, I'm taking them to his family.  If you wish to open it, please be careful.

head_text.subj: COMPUTERIZED SCREEN DISPLAY, (INT. PLANE - MOVING - DAY)

text: on the cabin wall displays a colorful map showing the fli point of departure in Sydney, continuously updating dista direction and time to its ultimate destination, Atlanta,

- folks, we're a little over two and a  half hours from touchdown in Atlanta, but  if you look out your windows on either  side of the aircraft, we'll soon be  crossing the southern section of the Rocky  Mountains, a range which includes more  than 50 peaks rising above 14,000 feet.   The chain's loftiest point, Mount Elbert,  at 14, 433 feet should be coming into view  as we pass over central Colorado shortly..

seems intent on the map, its changing times and distance. checks his watch - the countdown has gone from 20 to thre and 32 minutes as Nekhorvich is mesmerized by the descend seconds whipping by. ETHAN HUNT sits into shot on the vacant first class aisle beside Nekhorvich.
You keep staring at that watch as if your life depended on it, Doctor..
Well, yes.  I suppose I am a bit anxious.
They're ready and waiting.  You'll soon be  with old friends.
(meaning Ethan)
I'm with an old friend now, Dmitri.
Sorry it couldn't be under happier  circumstances.
Yes, I'm sorry too.. 'You're sorry and I'm sorry..' (bemused laughter, then looks at Ethan)
- you do know Gradski thought the world of you. Nekhorvich is overcome.  Ethan puts a comforting hand on shoulder:
He was quite a man.  Did he know before  the end you two had succeeded?
Yes, he knew.  Just..
..not in time to save him.
No.  After you've lived with  Chimera for  twenty hours, nothing can save you.  Not  even... Bellerophon. Nekhorvich pats the satchel.
You carry them together?  Safely? With an almost impish grin and a wink:

Yes, and you'll get us to a safe place  with them, thank god!..left to my own  devices, I'm an old fart too inept to read  a railroad timetable!.. Good-natured laughter.  Cut off by a flight steward who p by, giving a sidelong silence in Ethan and Nekhorvich's d Oxygen masks suddenly deploy from the ceiling.  Passenger puzzled and alarmed.

You Captain again.  We've experienced a  slight but abrupt drop in cabin pressure.. A passenger struggling with his mask.  As Nekhorvich fumb the strap on his mask he notes that the display screen sh their altitude is below 30,000 feet and dropping.  He che countdown time on his watch again.  Nekhorvich looks arou The flight attendants are conspicuously absent and all th passengers who have on oxygen masks are passed out.
The flight crew now wearing their oxygen masks.
(into radio)

Pan, pan, pan, Denver Center.  This is  Trans Pac Flight two-two-zero-seven, 747  heavy.  We are not reading you.  We're  unable to maintain cabin pressurization.   We have initiated a descent to one six thousand. The Co-pilot is working on the plane's altitude when his slip off the controls.  His eyes flutter, then:

Captain, I don't..can't.. He passes out.  The Captain, HUGH STAMP, turns to verify relief pilot is also unconscious at the controls. He then removes his oxygen mask, sets the auto pilot, inp numbers to slow the plane and descend.  As the craft titl downward...
The flight attendants are pulling on jump suits.  Stamp e from the cockpit.
Ethan returns.  Nekhorvich beckons to him.  Ethan sits. around, Nekhorvich conspiratorially:
..it seems we have a problem, Dmitri.
(in the same tone)
You keep calling me Dmitri.  You really  shouldn't. Nekhorvich's eyes narrow.
You're not Dmitri? With a lightning swift move Ethan breaks Nekhorvich's nec
- no. He grabs the satchel. ETHAN (cont'd) (to Wallis)
Wallis, hold onto it. Wallis slashes the satchel handle open, takes the satchel Ambrose.  He peels off the latex mask, revealing SEAN AMB ETHAN (cont'd)
Ulrich, pull the - He tears off the vocal oscillator at his adam's apple, cl throat, now as Ambrose:
- pull the NO2 tank and dump it, it's potential evidence.
(the 'captain' into shot)
All done, chief..
(what else)
- right - (kidding)
- don't go too far ahead of me now -

Not possible.. Ulrich has rolled back the carpet over an access panel ju beneath them that leads to the belly of the plane.  Stamp back the panel, hops into the compartment below which is walls of electronic equipment.  Stamp kneels and slides b floor hatch.  The wind howls, puffs of cloud zip by benea As they descend into the belly:
Checkpoint Charlie plus 30, altitude minus  two-zero-thousand.  Airspeed one-seven- niner knots..
It's that time.  Go. They don goggles and, with Ambrose in the lead,  the team leaps, one after another from the hatch, sailing into the sky.
An automated voice repeats in an ominous monotone:

Terrain, terrain.  Pull up, pull up. The co-pilot stirs.  He blearily rouses himself just in t see: A mountain rushing toward him.  As mountain meets airplan frame is filled with fire, but when camera pulls back fro fireball, it is in fact no more than a match head filling which ignited, lights a fuse.. The MI theme music kicks in, the main credits roll to:

For a moment it might be thought part of the same range w plane crashed but when Ethan Hunt climbs into frame the a widen and titles down, revealing more of where he's come than where he's going.  Aside from the fact that he's in midst of free-climbing what is easily a sheer rock face o least a thousand feet, there's the sunny picture-postcard a lovely valley and pellucid lake thousands of feet below climbs out of shot.

revealing the summit, a light breeze hitting the lichen a whatever growth has a slender purchase on the rocky mount fluffy clouds overhead. Ethan into shot.  Despite the spectacularly precarious ha he's using to hang onto the mountain and his life, he app relaxed, engaged - for him - in the equivalent of busman' holiday.  It's leisurely danger for Ethan; one might almo expect to hear Julie Andrews trilling 'Climb Every Mounta the soundtrack. Then a rock he's been grasping crumbles and Ethan drops a inches before he grabs onto the mountain again.  As he ha five fingers thousands of feet above the earth he doesn't terribly concerned until he spots a helicopter. It's materialized behind the summit and passes surprising just overhead, casting its shadow downward over Ethan.   Instinctively, Ethan flattens himself against the rock su as if the copter poses some sort of threat to him.  But w its rotors whir it into the distance Ethan relaxes and re climb.

near the summit Ethan departing from the vertical and is traversing the mountain with more of his back than his fe exposed to the earth far below.  He's clinging to the mou almost like a fly walking on the ceiling.  When he reache handhold that will restore him to the vertical, he dislod lizard - and manages to catch it before it plunges thousa feet to oblivion.
Whoaa.. He pockets the lizard, climbs the overhang.
with Ethan's hand, then Ethan coming into view and making summit.  He reaches into his pocket and releases the liza favors Ethan with a stern reptilian stare by way of grati lizard:

You're welcome. The lizard scampers off, then a low beeping sound at his attracts his attention.  He turns to see the source of th beeping, a small package in day-glo colors with a day-glo streamer.  Ethan looks to the sky where the helicopter is ominously circling back. Ethan lifts the day-glo package and waves it in the direc the copter.  With a distinct lack of enthusiasm. The helicopter once again turns, banks and disappears.  E opened the beeping package and finds a pair of sunglasses
First, a retinal scan.
Identity confirmed.
Good morning, Mr. Hunt. Swanbeck's face flashes onscreen.  Over his introduction is a series of satellite photographs whose subject is so she never seems to give the camera a clean shot.

Your mission, should you choose to accept  it, requires you to recover a stolen item,  designated  Chimera. Essential to the  mission is the recruitment of a civilian --  a Miss Nyah Nordoff-Hall.  She is a highly  capable professional thief currently  active in Spain. A series of Nyah's 'accomplishments', i.e., warrants, com Interpol summaries of her various criminal activities, as glimpses of the elusive Nyah circulating about Seville. SWANBECK'S VOICE (cont'd)

Her dossier's available on I-COM 3.  You  have 48 hours to recruit Ms. Nordoff-Hall  and meet me in Seville to receive further  details.  Should you or any member of your  IM force be caught or killed, the  Secretary will disavow all knowledge of  your actions. Swanbeck's face reappears on screen: SWANBECK'S VOICE (cont'd)

And Mr. Hunt - the next time you go on  vacation, please be good enough to let us  know where you're going.  This message will  self-destruct in five seconds. Ethan removes the glasses, then tosses them into space.
If I let you know where I'm going - The glasses explode in a puff of smoke. ETHAN (cont'd)

- won't be on holiday. Ethan, with a fair amount of disgust, gets to his feet an off the mountain, in, what for a moment looks like a suic snit.  Then, somewhere hundreds of feet below camera, the little puff of color as the tulip-shaped chute pops out o back-pack.  Begin the sound of a castanets and the animal of flamenco dancers.
Bustling in the activity of a large private party, with a guests and attentive valets, as a young woman, her face u exits her car and enters the villa.

head_text.subj: A FLASH OF SKIRT AND LACE

text: where to the cries of dancers add graceful feminine hands wielding the castanets.  The dancers perform on a raised and NYAH NORDOFF-HALL'S face can be glimpsed thru the swi skirts and pounding heels, looking thru, not at them.

looking back in a similar way to Nyah; surreal lighting a relentless chorus of pounding heels seem to isolate them crowed party.  Nyah continues to look at Ethan over the s over her wanna-be escort, a very attentive gentleman.  Ny offers up her empty glass, and the gentleman eagerly take the bar for a refill, leaving Nyah and Ethan looking at o another.  Ethan approaches her.
Do you know me?
No.  Should I?
No.  You just looked as if you did.
No.  Just as if I'd like to.
Oh.  Well.  I think that can be arranged.
Not tonight.  Bad timing.  Sorry -
There's not enough time in the world for  any of it to be bad. This stops her.  Nyah moves closer to him, until they're to nose.  Whispered but breezy:
Look, it's either you or the rent and I  don't mind telling you it's not an easy  choice.
What if I pay the rent?
Uh-huh.
Uh-huh? Glancing at the gentleman making his way back with her dr then:
Go find the wealthy lady you came with and  next time we meet - I'll pay your rent.  (kissing him, sweetly)

Now bugger off. And purposeful creature that she is, she takes her frustr desire upstairs, timing her footsteps so as to use the so the dancer's steps to cover her own.  Once upstairs, a se guard near the master bedroom can be seen eagerly followi down the hall, both moving past a pair of windows, visibl Ethan.  In a few moments, Nyah can be seen past the  windows in the opposite direction, without the guard foll In another moment or two, a very puzzled looking security can be glimpsed in the first window, looking up and down hall, clearly having lost sight of Nyah.  Ethan smiles, m of shot.
Nyah has opened the door and moves swiftly thru the bedro

A decadent looking affair with suggestive lighting, mirro walls.  The tub has a tray across it which includes a win chilling a bottle of Crystal and a mound of caviar on a b ice.  Nyah can't resist.  She spoons a dollop of the cavi downs it before she moves along the frescoed walls of the its back.  There, she pulls out her compact and removes t revealing an electronic density meter.  She turns it on a it at the rear of the tub.  Its sweep gauge jumps sharply green thru yellow and into red.
(her fondest hopes confirmed)

Mmmm. She now steps into the tub and focuses on the grout betwe tiles just above the sop dish.  Her knee eyes search for cracks in the grout and she spots one.  Using a tweezers pulls the silver of the grout out from between the tiles, something that looks like a credit card wedged between th She slips the card into a narrow opening under the sop di There's the sound of hydraulics and two arms move the mar casing out from the rear of the tub.  Nyah breathes a sig relief and anticipation: kneeling in the tub she finds he looking down at an open safe, revealing some half-dozen l compartments.  As she studies them:
Decisions, decisions. Nyah looks up to see Ethan's reflection in the bathroom  mirrors, looking down at her kneeling in the tub.
What are you doing here?
Think you're the only one who can pick a  lock?
(not altogether pleased)
I see.  You're not just another pretty face.. Before Ethan can answer, a voice can be heard coming from bedroom warbling Granada in Spanish, and with considerabl NYAH (cont'd)

Oh god.  A bloody baritone. Nyah catches a reflection behind Ethan's in the bathroom She reaches up and grabs Ethan by the lapel, yanking him tub, pulling him down on top of her.  Once again they're nose.

I take it you prefer tenors. She glances up at the mirror.  In it is the reflection of AUGUSTO DE L'ARENA, a big amiable Castilian in his fiftie changing a white dinner jacket that's had wine split on i breaks into a heavily accented version of 'Now or Never', disappears from the dressing room mirror.
Would you mind if I'm on top?

Oh, either way works for me. With a jaundiced look she rolls over on top of Ethan and working on one of the safe compartments, using a tiny tor wrench from a tube of lipstick and a carbide pick from a brush.  She glances down and is rather disconcerted.  Con working with the pick and wrench.
You're never gonna find it there.
(she jumps, dropping the torque wrench)
Damn it!  Find what?
His ex-wife's Bulgari necklace that goes  up for auction Tuesday. Looking down to Ethan, a touch of indignation:

more or less, hands locked behind his neck as he rests ag the raked back of the tub, his eyes and nose inches from lower pelvic region as she straddles him.  Not exactly in to move: She stiffens - he knows too damn much.
- right..where is it?
Far right.  She immediately switches her efforts from top left to the bottom right compartment.  She's utterly nonplussed:
Where's the bloody -
(plucking it off his chest, offering it up like a mechanic under the chassis)
- torque wrench.
- this is very disconerting..
Hey, you put me here.  I just do what I'm told.
- right.. She unstraddles him and, with a few deft moves with the t wrench and carbide pick - and it's open.  She withdraws a pouch and opens the pouch.  Out spills the spectacular ne NYAH (cont'd)
Lovely. (starting to close the safe)
Who are you and what's it going to cost me?
(having sat up)
I wouldn't do that.
Do what? The alarm goes off.
That. The bathroom is suddenly filled with security guards, gun Senor de l'Arena, looking highly upset, pops in.
Oh, Senor Keyes, thank God it is you! (in Spanish to security guards, annoyed)
It's Senor Keyes, the security engineer.
Well, Senor de l'Arena the goods news is that the heat sensors were activated.   But Miss Nordoff-Hall, my associate - Senor de l'Arena kisses Nyah's hand.
Mucho gusto, senorita.
- did feel that she had rather too long to work on the safe before they triggered the alarm, isn't that right Miss Hall?
Oh yes.  Absolutely.  Much too long I should yes. Nyah's initial shock and panic slowly gives way to a wary intensified curiosity - about Ethan.
Under the circumstances I think we would recommend re-setting the senors to respond to a lighter load.  How do you feel about forty kilos, Miss Hall?
Indeed.

Well, Senor de l'Arena, there's no reason  to disrupt your party any longer.  we have some further concerns about the disposition of your security guards, which you'll receive in our written report by fax in the morning, hard copy to follow.  Shall we? He offers Nyah his arm.  They start out.  Ethan immediate ETHAN (cont'd)
Miss Hall. Haven't you forgotten something? Nyah looking genuinely puzzled.
The necklace? Nyah slowly reaches into her dress and withdraws the glit string of diamonds and rubies from her bust.
(a great kidder)
What are you trying to do, senorita?  Rob me. They all laugh, and Ethan's got her out the door.
The stars dimming, the sky a gun metal blue.  Ethan and N emerge from the villa, walking slowly.  Nyah's clearly preoccupied.
I'm missing something here, aside from a 500,000 pound necklace.  Even after I botched the job, I could've walked out of  there with the bloody thing.
At least you walked.
If you weren't going to let me get away with it, why did you let me go thru with it?
Wanted to see how good you were. I'm hoping we might work together.
May I say something, no offence?  You look like a gigolo, you sound like a  thief, you act like a cop - what the bloody hell do you have in mind?
Working under adverse conditions.  Highly adverse conditions.
Sounds smashing.  I'm in.  Muchacho, mi carro, por favor!  Now be serious.  You couldn't possibly want me off tonight's performance..
You didn't do that badly. Her car arrives.
(as she moves to her car)
You're apologizing for me?  Quite the gentleman..
(opening the car door)
Not really.  I triggered the alarm.. One foot on the floorboard she freezes, back to Ethan.
Hey, the Bulgari job last week was flawless.  And I've always been partial to pale yellows. She slides behind the wheel.
(as he leads on the car)

I don't do laundry, or put up with cheeky bastards who set me up on their territory so they can poach on mine. She takes off, spewing bits of gravel and dust in her wak Ethan smiles and shakes his head.
around curves, hair flying, she's free.  Her car phone ri Perplexed, she lets it ring once or twice picks it up:
(tentatively)
Hola..
Hi.  Would you mind slowing down?
Where did you get this number?  I don't even have it!
Would you like it? She hits the End button and disconnects.  The phone immed rings again.  She refuses to pick up.  Ethan pulls alongs She looks at him.  They speak through the open cars.
Pull over and listen to me, will you? Just listen..
Listen to what?
I need your help and I thin you can use mine.
Your help?  What are you talking about?
Scotland Yard, Interpol, every Dutch authority.  I can make them go away.
Oh bloody hell.  You're a spy. She floors it and shoots ahead of Ethan, nicking his car
(to himself)
I deserved that.

Ethan rings her again.  And keeps ringing.  Her face beco grim, her flight progressively more desperate and with Et pursuit progressively more determined.  They are reaching limits of adhesion around blind curves.

The sky's battleship gray; Ethan pursues Nyah around hair turns high above the Costa del Sol; they rip thru patches marine fog drifting on the road, obscuring it. Both are appalled by the other's willingness to escalate this game of flight and pursuit until Ethan tears thru a and sees on his GPS what Nyah can't see thru the fog -  less than four hundred meters ahead is a turn she can't p negotiate and if she can't she'll plunge off the road hun feet to rock and sea below.  Ringing her number again:
(half to himself)
Slow down, slow down. She turns up a mound and loses control.  She spins out an toward the edge of the cliff.
(realizing she's in trouble)
Uh-oh. Ethan cuts her off and sends them both into a 540 degree Her car stops just at the cliff's edge. Furious she wrenches open the car door and gets out.
No! Suddenly there's no Nyah.  Ethan leaps over to Nyah's car sees Nyah dangling over the ocean and rocks hundreds of f below, holding the door handle.
Oh..oh.. Taking a firm grip on her wrist.
Don't look down.  Just..look at me. That's it..that's it.. He pulls Nyah up to the car, across the seat and half int his arms.  For a long moment it looks like she's in shock
What's you name?
Ethan Hunt.
Well, Ethan Hunt, what is it you want to talk to me about? Thru the veil of morning fog, Nyah looks at Ethan.  Her d suggest wit, and willingness, and longing.
...more than I thought.. They scarcely to move to bring their lips together:
Awfully short notice..
Care to wait a decent interval?
Who wants to be decent?..

sleeping.  His eyes open slowly.  He comes to full consci his head still on the pillow.  Something approaching seri anxiety informs his features.  He lifts his head and look left, angle widening.  Nyah lies on her side facing him, sleeping serenely.  Anxiety on the order of oh-God-this-i approved-recruiting-technique, confirmed.  He lets his he back on the pillow.  Then he turns so he and Nyah are pro profile.  As he looks at her sleeping his anxiety fades, by curiosity and even wonder.  He lifts his hand and just brushes her cheek.  Her eyes open.  She knows where she i
So what've you got against spooks? Nyah smiles.
When they've got your recruiting technique?  Not a thing.
Oh.  Well..this isn't exactly by the book.
They've got a book for this?
They've got a book for everything.

The only other spook I knew was a liar. Charming but absolutely incapable of telling the truth.  He'd lie about his favorite color.  But then I reckon it's an occupational hazard.  All spies really do is conceal the truth and tell lies.
Not revealing information doesn't necessarily make someone a liar.
That's not the point.  In the end what spies rely on is the one thing they think they know that you don't.
Which is?
That they're lying. Ethan laughs. NYAH (cont'd)
..once they know that they can get very very..crosee.. Nyah shoulder and moves into Ethan.
So where did I got right?
You're not a liar.  Or you're an awfully good one.. (then)
..this thing these blokes pinched..
I don't know that they 'pinched' it. Don't even know that they're blokes. Nyah stops to think about this.
Well, then, what I am I doing here?  I assume I'm meant to be some sort of thief-to catch-a-thief..
So do I.  Sort of. Nyah looks at Ethan, a little worried.
Spoken like a spook..you ever afraid?
Of what? Nyah laughs.
Ask a question, you get an answer!..
Damn, you're beautiful.
That's because I'm on my back. Quick as a cat Ethan flips Nyah over so she's looking dow at him.
I don't think so. She sinks into his arms.

Ethan's step is unusually jaunty as he bounces along, mak way thru the festive and jostling crowds preparing for th Crema portion of the  Fallas de Valencia. On this night great papier mache effigies, some serious, some comic, are placed all city and torched in great bonfires.  Outside the bar Etha looking for there's a street vendor, hawking Fallas memen flowers.  He starts past the vendor, and it hits him - he to buy some flowers. He chooses a colorful spring bouquet so fresh the dew can seen on the petals.  Ethan pays the vendor, starts into t and thinks better of walking into Swanbeck with the bouqu Turns back to the vendor.
Are you gonna be here a while?
Si, senor.
I'll pick'em up on my way out, okay? Ethan enter the bar and goes upstairs to the second floor he passes security at a pair of double doors.

Swanbeck stands looking out the window.  Noisy crowds fro festival provides a constant walla, and during the sequen first effigies are lit, and smoke and flame provide a viv background thru briefing room's window.
Fetival's a pain in the ass.  Honoring saint by setting'em on fire. (turning to Ethan)
Sit down, sit down. Ethan sits. SWANBECK (cont'd)

Let's you know what they think of saints, doesn't it?  Damn near set me on fire on my way over here.  As if I haven't been burned enough today. A moment where it's impossible to tell which way the wind going to blow between these two.  Then civilly: SWANBECK (cont'd)
Sorry I barged in on your vacation.
Sorry I didn't let you know where I was.
Don't be.  Wouldn't be on vacation if you did.
Well.  You're sorry and I'm sorry.
Why did you phrase it like that?
Like what?
'You're sorry and I'm sorry.'
You gotta be kidding. Swanbeck turns to his computer and begins play on a DVD, projected onto a computer screen staring back at Ethan is
(with exaggerate brio)
Well, Dmitri!  How are you?.. Nekhorvich pauses as if waiting for reply.  Ethan smiles.
..I'm fine..and you?
I'm fine.. Ethan laughs.
I'm fine and you're fine.. With Ethan simultaneously whispering:

I'm fine too.. I'm fine and you're fine - do you remember, dear fried, how you got Sergei and I to repeat those lines from Dr. Strangelove and we gave you the name of that  silly Soviet Premier because we didn't know your name?..In those days, you not only saved our lives, you saved our sanity.  'Now, then Dmitri - we have this little problem': Every search for a hero must begin with something that every hero requires; a  villain.  Therefore, in a search for our hero, Bellerophon, we created a monster Chimera.  I beg you, Dmitri, come to Sydney and accompany me to Atlanta immediately. However we travel, I must arrive at me destination, within 20 hours of departure. Forgive this fanciful explanation, but for now prudence dictates that I communicate nothing but the gravest urgency. I fear I can entrust this to no one but you, Dmitri.  as we say, 'I'm sorry and you're sorry'.. Swanbeck stops the DVD.
Let me ask you something.  You have any idea what the hell he's talking about? Ethan smiles.
An idea, yeah.
Like?
Like it's a good idea to pick him up in a hurry.  And a bad idea to fly him on a commercial carrier.  So let's get on with it.  He's still in Sydney?

Dr. Vladimir Nekhorvich is dead.  So is his colleague, Gradski, but that happened earlier.  We had Nekhorvich on a flight from Sydney that crashed in the Rockies.. Ethan sits back, heavily. SWANBECK (cont'd)
- Hunt, are you listening?.. Slowly looking up:
If he didn't want to go anywhere without me, how did you get him on the flight?

You were there. Swanbeck clears his throat.  He turns back to the compute punches in:  MISSION DOUBLE IMAGE. File open to computer scans of AMBROSE, SEAN, and HUNT, ETHAN, the computer scanning comparing their features, millimeter by millimeter, stat as the computer then imposes, with the help of the physio scan, Ethan's face on Ambrose: hence, mission double imag
slowly looks up at Swanbeck.
When I couldn't find you, I had to replace you.  Sean Ambrose was the obvious choice. He double you, what?  Two, three times?
Twice.
What did you think of him?
You know we had reservations about each other.  Isn't it a little late in the day to be asking me that?
Not necessarily. Swanbeck shows Ethan a photo of airline Captain.

Airline record list Captain Harold Macintosh as the pilot for Flt 2207.  as far as the media and all governmental agencies are concerned, Captain Macintosh died on the flight, but in fact he missed it.  He did, however make the next flight - in cargo, stuffed into a rather small  suitcase considering his size. Another photo of an open suitcase, the body in it partial obscured by a ring of police and customs officers. SWANBECK (cont'd)

Someone on that flight planned an operation designed to down the plane and make it look like an accident.  Someone skillful enough to bring the whole thing off without a hitch but - they don't always get your luggage on the plane, even when you fly first class.
So there's one thing we know Ambrose doesn't.
Then you do think it was Ambrose. Ethan barely nods. SWANBECK (cont'd)
And you're not surprised. Ethan gives Swanbeck a look.
Whatever Nekhorvich was carrying Sean wanted and he wanted to conceal the fact that he took it.
Enough to kill Nekhorvich and two hundred innocent passengers? Ethan smiles.
Sean feels he hasn't done the job unless he leaves a lot of hats on the ground.
The question is why?  What was this Chimera Nekhorvich was carrying? Ethan rises and moves to the window.
Right now only Ambrose knows that.
In any case, you've got to recover Chimera and bring it to us.
In order to do that, I've got to figure out how he plans to make money with it.
- right.  In fact since the plane went down our banking sources have confirmed a marked increase in the stock pilling of cash in terrorists accounts.
'Terrorists?'
Well you know Nekhorvich's history. You're the one who got him out of the Soviet Union was it still in bio- weapon business.
If that's what you're thinking Ambrose would have set up a bidding situation with any number of buyers before he got on the plane.  Locating him in time to stop something like that -
- is where Miss Hall comes in.
(blindsided)
Excuse me?
Miss Hall and Ambrose had a relationship which he took very seriously.  She walked away and he's wanting her back ever since.  We believe she's our surest and  quickest way of location him.
(acidly)
And then what?
Then makes sure she continues to see him. Gets him confide in her and report to you.
You made it sound as if I was recruiting her for her skills as a thief.

Oh, by the way, you might want to take a look at these..if you have any further qualms about getting her to do the job. Not that it matter much but..I seem to recall you staying something like, 'I was hoping we could work together.'

Go and insinuate yourself back into Sean's life.

Look, would it make you feel better if I didn't want you to do this?
Much.

Well.  That made all the difference in the  world, didn't it? Ethan walks out onto the balcony.  She looks at his back.
Sean will never be anything but suspicious if he picks up some sort of 'yoo-hoo-I'm- not-nad' message.  Not after the way we broke up.

Probably that I needed him in some urgent way..destitute - in serious trouble..the kind I couldn't possible sort out myself.. Ethan's been smiling slightly.
Serious trouble, Nyah, is something I can always arrange..
